drupalNodeEvent.title: Sino-Russian relations in the context of the war in Ukraine

field_speakers.processed: Dmytro Yefremov (Ukraine), Olena Bordilovska (Ukraine), Chelsea Ngoc Minh Nguyen (Indonesia), Gong Jiong (China), Graeme Robertson (the US), Jakub Jakóbowski (Poland).

field_organizers.processed: A. Krymskyi Institute of Oriental Studies, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, the National Institute of Strategic Studies, the Ukrainian Association of Sinologists and the Publishing House “Helvetica”

field_description.processed:
More then a year into the unpredictable war launched by Russia against Ukraine, China has appeared to re-articulate its position. The experts in this round table will join to discuss China's interests in the conflict, evaluate whether China's support for Russia has changed and whether China may play a role in the conflict's resolution.

The key questions:

- Does China's peace plan mark the end of its diplomatic ghosting of Ukraine?

- Does the "no-limits friendship" reach its limits in Ukraine?

- What economic leverage do the US and Europe have over Sino-Russian convergence?

- What are the potential implications of Sino-Russian cooperation for the global security?
